name: Ishmael
description: Firstborn of Abraham through Hagar, cast out but blessed. 'God hears' — his name fulfilled when God saved him in the wilderness. Wild donkey of a man, hand against all, yet father of twelve princes. Reconciled with Isaac at Abraham's grave.

archer-wilderness.name: Archer in the Wilderness
archer-wilderness.description: Ishmael as skilled archer in the desert of Paran
archer-wilderness.prompt: powerful archer in desert landscape - bow drawn, arrow nocked, eyes scanning the horizon. Muscular build from wilderness life, wearing rough desert garments. The wild donkey of a man in his element. Master of the bow, lord of the desert.

wild-donkey-man.name: Wild Donkey of a Man
wild-donkey-man.description: Ishmael embodying the angel's prophecy - untamed, free
wild-donkey-man.prompt: standing on desert ridge with wind in hair - wild, untamed appearance, defiant posture. Perhaps wild donkeys visible in background. 'His hand against everyone, everyone's hand against him' — but unbowed. The prophecy made flesh.

crying-under-bush.name: Crying Under the Bush
crying-under-bush.description: Young Ishmael dying of thirst, cast under the shrub
crying-under-bush.prompt: young boy lying under desert shrub - parched, weak from thirst, crying. Hagar visible in distance with hands over her face, unable to watch him die. The water gone, hope gone. But God hears.
crying-under-bush.energy: desperate, abandoned, but heard by God

well-appearing.name: The Well Appears
well-appearing.description: The moment of salvation - God opens their eyes to see water
well-appearing.prompt: young Ishmael or Hagar seeing the well appear - eyes wide with sudden hope, reaching toward water. Desert well revealed by divine providence. 'God opened her eyes and she saw a well of water.' Salvation in the wilderness.

banished-walking.name: Walking into Exile
banished-walking.description: Young Ishmael leaving Abraham's camp with Hagar
banished-walking.prompt: young boy walking into wilderness with mother - carrying a waterskin, looking back at the tents of Abraham's camp. Hagar beside him, face set toward the unknown. The firstborn cast out. Morning light, long shadows.

father-of-princes.name: Father of Twelve Princes
father-of-princes.description: Ishmael as patriarch of a great nation
father-of-princes.prompt: mature patriarch surrounded by symbols of his twelve sons - tribal banners, a great encampment stretching behind him. The promise fulfilled: 'I will make him a great nation.' Desert king, father of princes.

burying-abraham.name: Burying Abraham
burying-abraham.description: Ishmael and Isaac together at their father's grave
burying-abraham.prompt: standing beside Isaac at the cave of Machpelah - both carrying their father Abraham to burial. Years of separation dissolved in shared grief. The wild son returned for this sacred duty. Perhaps their eyes meeting in understanding.

rivalry-banishment.name: Rivalry: The Banishment
rivalry-banishment.description: Ishmael walking into exile while Isaac remains
rivalry-banishment.prompt: Young Ishmael walks away with Hagar into the wilderness, a waterskin over his shoulder. Looking back at the tents of his father's camp. Cast out but not forgotten by God. Dawn light, the vast desert ahead.

rivalry-at-well.name: Rivalry: At the Wilderness Well
rivalry-at-well.description: Ishmael at the well where God saved him
rivalry-at-well.prompt: Ishmael at the wilderness well where the angel saved him and Hagar. His bow at his side, the desert stretching around him. Survivor, blessed in a different way than Isaac. Wild and free, master of the wilderness.

rivalry-burial.name: Rivalry: Burying Their Father
rivalry-burial.description: Ishmael beside Isaac burying Abraham together
rivalry-burial.prompt: Ishmael beside Isaac, helping to bury their father. Years of separation dissolved. The wild man of the wilderness returned for this sacred duty. Dressed as a desert chieftain, bow at his side, but working alongside his brother in peace.
rivalry-burial.energy: Reconciliation, unity in grief, honoring the father
